content.question: The experiment is performed and both <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> are measured, but the measured value of <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is larger than the calculated value using the studentâ€™s equation. Which of the following sources of experimental error could have caused the discrepancy?

choices.label: Friction between the table and block 2 is not negligible.
The mass of block 2 is actually greater than the mass of block 1.
There is friction between the rim of the pulley disk and the string.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
